author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Fox Corp. and YouTube TV have reached a short-term agreement that will keep the company's networks on the streaming service for now, according to a source familiar with ongoing negotiations between the two sides. It is unclear when the short-term deal will expire, but the current agreement between Fox and the Google-owned subscription service was...
title: Fox and YouTubeTV reach short-term carrier deal

author: Ella Lee
description: The U.S. Air Force will provide Jan. 6 rioter Ashli Babbitt with military funeral honors, reversing a Biden-era decision that denied her family's request, according to a legal group that has represented her family. Judicial Watch, the conservative legal group, on Wednesday made public a letter from Under Secretary of the Air Force Matthew Lohmeier,...
title: Air Force to provide funeral honors to Ashli Babbitt

author: Rachel Frazin
description: {beacon} Energy & Environment Energy & Environment   The Big Story  FEMA places dissenting staffers on leave Employees at the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) were placed on leave on Tuesday after signing their names to a public letter criticizing the agency’s leadership, according to a group that helped facilitate the letter’s publication. © Greg...

author: Julia Mueller
description: The California Supreme Court rejected a petition Wednesday filed by state Republican legislators seeking to keep Gov. Gavin Newsom’s (D) plan to redistrict California’s congressional map off a special election ballot this fall.  A brief update in the docket announced the petition for a writ of mandate and a request for stay were denied just...
title: California Supreme Court rejects latest GOP effort to halt redistricting plan

description: Welcome to The Hill's Business & Economy newsletter {beacon} Business & Economy Business & Economy   The Big Story  Nvidia beats Wall Street expectations with Q2 revenue The chipmaker reported $46.7 billion in second-quarter revenue, up 6 percent from the previous quarter and 56 percent over the past year. © Jeff Chiu, Associated Press Wall...

author: Joseph Choi
description: The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) launched a war on labor unions representing its workers when it announced last week it would be derecognizing representation in several offices.  Although labor representatives maintain this move was illegal, a recent federal court decision paved the way for derecognition, at least while legal battles play out...
title: HHS goes to war against employee unions

author: Joseph Choi
description: Susan Monarez, the longtime government scientist recently confirmed as director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), has been let go from her position after less than a month in the role. A source familiar with the situation confirmed to The Hill that Monarez is ousted as CDC director. The Senate confirmed her...
title: CDC Director Susan Monarez ousted just weeks after confirmation

author: Brett Samuels
description: The suspected shooter who killed two children at a Minnesota church on Wednesday wrote incendiary messages on gun magazines, including one that read “Kill Donald Trump.” The images appeared in a manifesto posted online around the same time as the shooting on Wednesday morning. The manifesto included a lengthy written note from the suspected shooter...
title: Suspected Minnesota shooter's rifle magazine had ‘Kill Donald Trump’ inscription

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump is ramping up his power grab over Washington, D.C., on everything from the city’s law enforcement to a takeover of its transportation hub and key cultural center. He’s called for the death penalty in D.C. murder cases, cleared out homeless encampments, and is promising to fix everything from fences to light fixtures in...

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former Labor Secretary Robert Reich, who served in the Clinton administration, warned that President Trump’s personal involvement in the U.S. economy will be his “downfall” and will lead the country toward stagflation. In a Substack post Tuesday, Reich recalled a time when the parties were divided by disagreements over the size of government and support...
title: Robert Reich: Trump 'downfall' will be pushing economy toward stagflation

author: Jonathan Easley
description: Plus: Trump meets with Israeli officials {beacon} TWO CHILDREN were shot and killed Wednesday in the pews where they worshipped during the first week back after summer break at the Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis, Minn.   The victims were 8 years old and 10 years old.   Seventeen others were injured in the shooting,...

author: Tara Suter
description: Officials have identified Robin Westman as the suspect behind Wednesday’s shooting at a Minneapolis Catholic school, according to multiple reports. The Associated Press reported that Westman, 23, was identified as the person behind the shooting at Annunciation Catholic School, according to a law enforcement official. Police have said the shooter barricaded the church door during...
title: Minneapolis gunman identified: Reports

author: Filip Timotija
description: House Judiciary Committee Chair Jim Jordan (R-Ohio) invited the Reform U.K. leader Nigel Farage to a hearing on Capitol Hill next month to discuss overseas technology laws.  The hearing, titled “Europe’s Threat to American Speech and Innovation,” is scheduled to take place on Sept. 3.  The committee said the hearing will “highlight how European online...
title: Jim Jordan invites Nigel Farage to Capitol Hill for hearing on free speech

author: Britt Lampert and Anemone Franz, opinion contributors
description: The White House’s pandemic preparedness team has quietly withered to a single part-time employee.
title: The quiet collapse of America's pandemic preparedness

description: Related video: Trump's 50% Tariffs On India Take Effect Wednesday, Threatening $48.2B In Exports | NEWSNATION Three-quarters of surveyed U.S. voters say they wouldn’t trust Russian President Vladimir Putin to honor any peace deal reached to end the war in Ukraine, according to a recent Quinnipiac University poll. author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump’s approval rating has gone up by 5 points in the past month, with more than half of the public approving of his handling of crime amid the administration's federal takeover of Washington's police force, according to a new poll. The latest survey from The Associated Press/NORC, released Wednesday, found that 45 percent of...
title: Trump approval up 5 points in past month: Survey

author: Jenna Robinson, opinion contributor
description: President Trump signed a memorandum requiring increased transparency in higher education admissions, which can only be achieved by reinstating standardized testing requirements and prioritizing merit over identity.
title: Standardized testing is still the great equalizer

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent defended the U.S. taking a 10 percent stake in Intel amid concerns about government interference in the free market. “Chips are a strategic necessity for us,” Bessent told Maria Bartiromo on Wednesday during an appearance on Fox Business’s “Mornings with Maria.” “One of the things we learned during COVID was that...
title: Bessent defends stake in Intel: Chips 'strategic necessity'

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: In today's issue: 🚨 BREAKING  Minneapolis shaken by deadly shooting: At least two children were killed and more than a dozen others were injured in a shooting at a Catholic school in Minneapolis early Wednesday morning. Police said a gunman opened fire while children were seated in pews during Mass. Federal, state and local authorities have responded...

description: Related video: Will the National Guard Be Deployed To Chicago? Trump Says IL Gov. Should Be ASKING FOR HELP Only a third of Americans support the federal government taking charge of major cities’ police departments despite widespread concerns about the prevalence of crime in the country, a new poll found.  The Associated Press/NORC Center for...
title: Few support federal takeover of police despite crime concerns: Survey

author: Norman Eisen, Gabriel Lezra and Diamond Brown, opinion contributors
description: Launching this dangerous arms race is a morally compelled act of self-defense for democracy itself.
title: Newsom is right: Democrats must win the gerrymandering arms race

author: The Hill Staff
description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser will give an update Wednesday afternoon on the Trump administration's takeover of local law enforcement, a day after President Trump floated the death penalty for those convicted of murder in the nation's capital. Bowser has pushed back on the show of force, citing crime data that shows offenses are at...
title: Watch live: Bowser gives update on Trump DC police takeover

author: Julia Mueller
description: Democratic former Rep. Katie Porter (Calif.) is leading the crowded California governor’s race, new polling shows, though most voters are undecided about who should succeed term-limited Gov. Gavin Newsom (D).  A new survey from the Institute of Governmental Studies (IGS) at the University of California, Berkeley, found Porter was the first choice for 17 percent...
title: Porter leads crowded California governor race by 7 points; most voters undecided: Survey

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio (D) said Democrats would find more success electorally if they modeled their approach on Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani’s messaging style. “If Democrats talked the way Zohran Mamdani does about everyday affordability and the cost of living, if they focused like he did, Democrats would be winning...
title: De Blasio: Democrats 'would be winning all over the country' if they talked like Mamdani

author: Jos Joseph, opinion contributor
description: Immigrants and their children are assimilating into American culture, as evidenced by their participation in American traditions, sports, and the military, and the accomplishments of immigrants such as Usha Vance.
title: America is less white but it's still very American

author: Brooke Migdon
description: House Republicans introduced legislation Tuesday to ban transgender girls from participating in girls’ school sports, moving to advance one of the Trump administration's top priorities.  The measure, titled the “Safety and Opportunity for Girls Act,” would define “male,” “female” and “sex” by reproductive function in Title IX, the federal civil rights law against sex discrimination in education....
title: House Republicans file bill to bar trans students from bathrooms, sports teams

author: Meg Hilling
description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said in a recall notice that “the rear axle hub bolt may fatigue and break."
title: Recall issued for Ford F-150s over faulty rear axle hub bolt

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The Education Department announced Wednesday that the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) will be available on the normal October deadline for the 2026-2027 academic year after difficulties in previous years.   The Oct. 1 deadline has faced skepticism due to problems with the forms after then-President Biden’s revamp of the applications and concerns...
title: Education Department says FAFSA process will open in October

author: Ella Lee
description: Federal prosecutors are seeking a prison sentence of at least seven years for Nadine Menendez, who was convicted alongside her husband, former Sen. Bob Menendez (D-N.J.).
title: Prosecutors seek 7-year prison term for ex-Sen. Bob Menendez's wife Nadine Menendez

author: Filip Timotija
description: A majority of Americans say the federal government should not control the content of exhibits in museums that get taxpayer funding, according to a survey published Tuesday.  The latest the Economist/YouGov poll found only 18 percent of respondents saying the government should control the content of exhibits in federally funded museums, compared to 60 percent...
title: 60 percent say government should not control museum content: Poll

author: Arturo McFields, opinion contributor
description: Regime change in Venezuela would deal a devastating blow to the agendas of China, Russia and Iran in the Western Hemisphere.
title: The US should overthrow Maduro in Venezuela

author: Kevin Igoe, opinion contributor
description: Many of the policy aspects that MAGA wants, especially those that smack of revenge, are out of step with the majority of voters.
title: The MAGA agenda pushes Trump out of the mainstream

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump's steep tariffs on India as a penalty for buying Russian oil took effect on Wednesday, bringing the import tax imposed on the trading partner to 50 percent. Trump said he would hit India with a 25 percent penalty for the oil purchases that he argued are helping fuel Moscow’s war efforts in Ukraine, on top of a...
title: Steep US tariffs take effect on India over Russia oil

author: Rob Taub
description: Frontier says new routes from Fort Lauderdale, Florida, will depart for Detroit, Houston, Chicago and Charlotte.
title: Frontier Airlines adds 20 new flights after taking over Spirit's routes

author: Mike Lillis
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) warned this week that if President Trump and his GOP allies expand their gerrymandering efforts beyond Texas, Democrats will respond in kind. Democratic legislators in California have already advanced new House maps designed to nullify the GOP’s new advantage in Texas, where Republicans, at Trump’s request, redrew their lines...
title: Jeffries says Dems ready to redistrict beyond California to counter ‘desperate Republicans’

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump said that he plans to look into NBC’s decision to extend "Late Night" host Seth Meyers’ contract, slamming the comedian as a “dope.” “There is a sick rumor going around that Fake News NBC extended the contract of one of the least talented Late Night television hosts out there, Seth Meyers,” Trump wrote...
title: Trump vows to look into Seth Meyers’ late night contract

author: Richard Koral, opinion contributor
description: In the classic British comedy “Bedazzled,” Dudley Moore's character sells his soul to the devil, played by a suave Peter Cook, in exchange for seven wishes. It seems that he is in love with the waitress at the lunch counter where he works, but she won’t give him the time of day.  Throughout the movie...
title: AI really isn't that intelligent after all

author: Alexis Simendinger
description: President Trump is expected to get his wish on lower interest rates within weeks, but his brass-knuckled battle with the Federal Reserve will likely drag on much longer.
title: Trump tests Fed independence in court

author: Meg Hilling
description: According to consultants at Korn Ferry, a growing number of American employees are displaying what is colloquially known as “job hugging."
title: Employees 'job hugging' amid labor market uncertainty

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump said he raised $1.5 billion since he was elected in November, hitting a milestone in contributions. “I am pleased to report that I have raised, since the Great Presidential Election of 2024, in various forms and political entities, in excess of 1.5 Billion Dollars. MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN!!!” he wrote early Wednesday on...
title: Trump says he has raised $1.5B since 2024 election

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Republican lawmakers on Capitol Hill are skeptical about President Trump’s attempt to fire Lisa Cook, the first Black woman to serve on the Federal Reserve’s Board of Governors, but they’re keeping quiet for now to avoid a direct confrontation with Trump. Republican sources say that Senate Republicans didn’t support Cook’s nomination to the Fed when...
title: Republicans skeptical but quiet on Trump’s attempt to fire Fed board member

author: Filip Timotija
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has put forward a peace proposal to end the war that involves the Donetsk region in eastern Ukraine, an offer that Ukraine is unlikely to accept, according to President Trump’s special envoy Steve Witkoff.  “The Russians have put a peace proposal on the table. It involves Donetsk. It may not be,...
title: Putin put forward peace proposal involving Donetsk, Witkoff says

author: Jared Gans
description: Democrats continued their winning streak in key special elections this year with another victory in a contested state Senate seat in Iowa.  The party eyed the seat as a pickup opportunity to break up a Republican supermajority in the body and demonstrate further enthusiasm among the Democratic base in an off-year election. The party’s candidate...
title: Key takeaways from Tuesday's special elections in Iowa and Georgia

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump and Vice President Vance on Tuesday met with a delegation of Indiana state GOP lawmakers as the White House pushes for the Hoosier State to undertake a redistricting effort that could net the party additional House seats. Dozens of Indiana Republicans met with White House officials in the Eisenhower Executive Office Building, with...
title: Indiana Republicans visit White House amid redistricting push

author: Jared Gans
description: Democrat Catelin Drey has flipped an open Iowa state Senate seat, adding to the party’s successes in special elections this year, Decision Desk HQ projected. Drey defeated Republican Christopher Prosch in the race to replace the late state Sen. Rocky De Witt (R), who died in office in June from cancer. Democrats homed in on...
title: Democrats flip Iowa state Senate seat, breaking GOP supermajority

author: Filip Timotija
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom’s (D) popularity has grown among Democratic voters in recent months as he has emerged as a possible top contender for the party's 2028 presidential nominee, according to a new poll that was released on Tuesday.  The new Morning Consult survey found that Newsom’s support among Democrats and Democratic-leaning independents has increased by...
title: Newsom's popularity grows in 2028 primary field: Poll
